title: Strictly's Dianne Buswell poses with red-haired fan after It Takes Two
text:
Dianne meet… Dianne (Picture: James Curley)

Dianne Buswell saw red on Thursday night as she met a miniature version of herself while leaving It Takes Two.

Appearing on the Strictly Come Dancing sister show after scoring 36 points for her impressive Couple’s Choice routine with Dev Griffin, the star was all smiles as she left the studio.

Wearing an oversized denim jacket with cool beaded fringe detailing, the 30-year-old accessorised with a green cross-body handbag while wearing her hair in a low ponytail topped with a pearl headband.

Outside the studios, the Australian dancer, who is dating former Strictly contestant Joe Sugg, posed with her celeb partner Dev Griffin before making a beeline for a mini-me fan.

With hair dyed the exact shade of red as Dianne (now that’s commitment!), it was hard for the dancer to miss her, but Dianne still took time to pose for pictures with her number one fan.

We’re loving Dianne’s look… (Picture: James Curley)

With only two days to go until Dev and Dianne take to the dancefloor to perform their Cha Cha Cha to Dancing With a Stranger by Sam Smith and Normani, the couple headed back to rehearsals after appearing on the daily Strictly talk show.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘And back to the studio after it takes two,’ she shared on Instagram.

…and so, it seems, was her fan! (Picture: James Curley)

Following the drama of last week’s rehearsals, the couple wanted to make sure everything was fully rehearsed ahead of the live show after Dianne ended up in hospital after Dev dropped her during rehearsals.

Speaking about the incident, Dev admitted: ‘We had this lift where Dianne is on my shoulders and we had an accident and we were like let’s take it out, mainly because I was getting so stressed out about it.’

‘It was such an awful feeling even though Dianne’s a pro and it’s happened to you loads of times, but for me, I was like, “I don’t want to do it.” It was scary,’ he added.

Dianne didn’t seem so traumatised by the fall though and instead giggled: ‘I think I’ve scarred him for life.’

Got a showbiz story? If you've got a story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk Entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page - we'd love to hear from you.

description: Dianne Buswell saw red on Thursday night as she met a miniature version of herself while leaving It Takes Two.
